H0.text: What is the painful and incurable, so far, condition characterised by uterine cells growing outside the uterus. Adenomyosis

H1.text: What is the painful and incurable, so far, condition characterised by uterine cells growing outside the uterus. Uterine Fibroids

H2.text: What is the painful and incurable, so far, condition characterised by uterine cells growing outside the uterus. Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID)

H3.text: What is the painful and incurable, so far, condition characterised by uterine cells growing outside the uterus. Endometreosis

A4.text: Endometriosis is an inflammatory disease dependent on estrogen. The lesions promote local inflammation and immune system dysregulation.

A5.text: The World Health Organization estimates that endometriosis is the ultimate cause of female infertility in 4.8% of cases.
